cards.front: What keyword declares an immutable variable?
How do you make a variable mutable?
What is the ownership rule for values in Rust?
cards.back: Each value has exactly one owner. When the owner goes out of scope, the value is dropped.

cards.front: What does & mean in a function parameter?
cards.back: An immutable reference (borrowing without taking ownership)

cards.front: What is the difference between String and &str?
cards.back: String is an owned, heap-allocated string. &str is a borrowed string slice.
Propagates errors — returns early with Err if the Result is Err, otherwise unwraps the Ok value.

cards.front: What trait must a type implement to be printed with {:?}?
What is an enum with data called in Rust?
cards.back: A tagged union (or algebraic data type). Each variant can hold different data.
Auto-implements the Clone trait, allowing .clone() to create a deep copy.

cards.front: How do you handle a None value from an Option?
cards.back: Pattern matching (match/if let), .unwrap_or(), .unwrap_or_default(), or the ? operator with Option.

name: World Capitals
description: Match countries to their capital cities
